CatDescriptText: Mr. Serene Johnson, janitor, Homewood and Mrs. Irene Gee, hotel worker, Fifth Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the Christian Church is doing an effective job in improving racial amity in the city, nation and throughout the world?" Mr. Johnson's answer reads: "They are doing a much better job.  I don't think it will be too long before things will be real good."  Mrs. Gee's answer reads: "It is on the local and national scenes.  I can't say about the international level."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Serene Johnson wearing plaid zippered jacket and dark sweater, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Irene Gee wearing light colored overcoat with fur collar and earrings, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
